In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        
        if current_line_length + word_length <= text_width || iszero(current_line_length)
            # If we can fit the whole word on this line, do it
            result *= " " * word
            current_line_length += word_length + 1
        else
            # Start a new line with this word
            result *= "\n" * word
            current_line_length = word_length + 1
        end
    end
    
    return rstrip(result) # Remove trailing spaces and return
end

# Example usage:
example_text = "This is a long text string that needs to be wrapped at some point."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(example_text, text_width=10)
println(wrapped_text)
```
